page.title: 19EMPLOYMENT IN CRANHAM
page.content: Upminster is a relatively small dormitary settlement with a very large majority of its economically active population engaged in{service {employment}well outside the town.Most people commute by car,train, or underground to London where many have professional,skilled,or semi-skilled occupations.Others work mainly in {retailing and commerce}within 15 miles of Upminster,notably at Romford,Ilford and Barking.There is very little manufacturing and/or manual work available except along the north bank of the Thames and at Dagenham where a significant number still number still find employment at{Fords. Unemployment has risen steadily during the 1980's although the 5% rate is well below the national average.
